title: The Role of Background Information in Reducing Object Hallucination in Vision-Language Models: Insights from Cutoff API Prompting
author: Masayo Tomita (The University of Tokyo), Katsuhiko Hayashi (The University of Tokyo), Tomoyuki Kaneko (The University of Tokyo), ...
relevance_why: The findings about the importance of background context in reducing hallucination could inform approaches to multimodal tasks that combine audio and visual inputs, applicable in generative audio contexts.
background: This paper examines how visual prompts influence the accuracy of Vision-Language Models, particularly focusing on mitigating hallucinations related to object recognition in images.
contribution: This study introduces the concept of Cutoff API Prompting to enhance the effectiveness of visual prompting in reducing object hallucination, achieving improved accuracy in model outputs.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods focus mainly on either visual prompting without considering background information or solely on text/image accuracy without an integrated approach.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work emphasizes the preservation of background context alongside visual attention, demonstrating that incorrect outputs often arose from inadequate attention to background elements.

key_innovation: The unique approach of utilizing background context while prompting highlights that merely masking target objects can hinder recognition and accuracy.
real_world_impact: The proposed methods could significantly enhance the reliability of Vision-Language Models in practical applications such as automated visual analysis and medical diagnostics, reducing errors in object recognition tasks.
limitations: The study primarily evaluates only CLIP and LLaVA models, which may limit the generalizability of the findings to other Vision-Language Models.

new_terms.object hallucination: **Object hallucination** refers to inconsistent outputs generated by models that erroneously suggest the presence or absence of objects within input images.
new_terms.Cutoff API Prompting: **Cutoff API Prompting** is a technique that applies a threshold to visual prompts, focusing attention on the most relevant parts of an image to enhance recognition.
